page.title: 14Leisure Activities
page.content: The most time consuming form of leisure activity was watching the T.V. We investigated how much time children spent watching and found a wide range of times. About a third watched T.V. for less than an hour. Another third watched for about two hours. The remaining third were the addicts and watched for at least four hours. Only half the children read at some time most evenings, but about 80% of parents did some reading each evening. Only a few dads went to the pub most nights but more than 50% went about once a week. Most parents went out to dinner "occasionally" but did go out most weeks for varied leisure activities. None of the parents went to any evening classes. About 10% of children were members of clubs such as Scouts, Brownies, Boy's Brigade.
